Articles.Content:
I was trying to get the landing spot just right for Eve crew mission. I kept missing and missing the target and the last attempt I tried detaching some parts that led to collision meaning I would have to readjust the orbit. This was the third time and it seemed fine every time I tweaked the manuever a little bit.

But when I quickloaded what took 5 seconds became over 2 minutes of loading screen. I press Esc button and find no craft or no manuever node. I tried again and again with similar results. I then stopped KSP shut down the computer (which after rebooting seemed fine.) Restarted and got TONS of errors on the side (usually I only get one and that says Steam not connected usually meaning that my gameplay is not recorded on Steam). 

Most of them saying. Part doesn't exist

I try loading up the save with this:

 

I have spent over the past 2 weeks on this mission so I will do whatever it takes to save it...

I also have more video file just in case if you need more of leading up to the event

Edited August 7, 2020 by Guest

Update: I have checked the files and they seem fine...

EDIT: 3 hours later... yepp... looks like I might be alone about this... Time to get technical...

Edited August 8, 2020 by Guest
Okay so this is really weird but now for some reason it works...

7 hours ago, The Doodling Astronaut said:

Okay so this is really weird but now for some reason it works...

Can i ask three questions,

1)Did you verify the files on steam(i am guessing from what you said yes)

2)Do you have cloud saving enabled?

3)How often do you backup your saves?

I am glad it works now, personally i backup every time i play the game, which is a bit much but feels safe.
